title: Modal shifts made easy

Is.
One of one of the world's biggest ferry operators, we operate operates three different areas and we are actually inside the sphere which.
Has a revenue of a total 4.7 billion euros or nearly 5 billion euros, so it's quite big 17.
Route 30.

Three different fairies and totally in this where we are in a position of 200 ships, so it's quite big is also big challenge to introduce a framework and platform like E Freight for such a big company.

We are cooperating with the DGS.
One organization and the limb model we discussed here before.

The.

For a long time in the North and country, Sweden, Scandinavia, we have used a system called Farrell Photos and that is typically a EDI fact standard which has been used for many years and very, very successfully between shippers and forwarders.
Forward is like DSV, DHL and chancre.

And and and gases.

Administration for one thing, and.
That's quite big challenges.

I think it was very interesting to hear.

'cause that is one step and the legal issues is another step.

It will be just another way and we have to stack when we're stuck in the same administrative and problematic process is so from that point of view it's very important for the Commission to take back what we do here.

This part of the project.

I mean, that is typically an application on authorities and we.
We can say it's very good result if we can achieve that, but we can't really participate it because the benefits for us is when it's there not to participate in it.

They can take care of the deliverables without an organization with maintenance processes, this is doomed to go down to nothing.

If we can't develop and grow in it.
And GS one has showed us that this is possible already, I think, so that's very good.

And we are an operator and we make bookings today.

We fax email calls in.
We have interfaces.

Yeah.

This is 99% of the operational porters we have.

And and also be quick during responses to our customers.

Release ID is an identifier for a transport service which is allocated by Stena Line and this release ID is.
Identify looking like a booking reference on your flying tickets.
6 characters mixed with characters and figures so you can remember that.

When we have secure capacity.

The mission.

For this particular transport service.

It can be done in the back office stage.
It can also be done by the truck driver.
It can be done by the Internet, smartphone or also by in vehicle system.
Volvo and all the other vendors I suppose has different types of system.
Volvo has something they called dynafleet, which is of course interesting to discuss in this port.
How?
And in the end of the port, when you reach the port, we also have to have a certain service there.
We call self-service self-service check-in where you do the same thing more or less at the information, and then you go into the port.
We have to be this complicated because we have to apply.
We have to follow the ISP's rules, the AML rules which is stated for anti terrorism etc.
So we have to do these things and we also have to keep passenger lists for four accompanied drivers etc on our ships.
And this is done for all traffic driver company units, unaccompanied drop missions, and and unaccompanied collect missions.
Now, this is basically what happens now.
We will use a technical device too.
You have done the pre checkin already.
We will use the technical device to enter the release ID and be and detect the service.
Get the tickets for accessing the port and instead of looking at papers.
Which is the common way to deal with these things?
Today it's a bunch of papers.
I am old papers, DGZ and CMRS.
We will have to do the spot checks on the quayside which we already does will do, so it's not a problem for us.
And we will also have a gate exit which is handled the other kiosk.
Self-service check-in as an alternative if you haven't done the pre checkin and also manual handling, there are some cargo which can't be covered by our solution.
Typically windmill.
Some things like that they are quite long and quite complicated to book, so electronic system is not so good for them.
And the benefits we like to achieve.
10 minutes in average reduction in check-in time.
In Port operation Time for our customers.
50% reduction on manual check-in activities and that is typically what we save in manual work in our ports we have 30 ports.
That's quite many, quite lots of manual reduction we will do.

And in a longer perspective, we like to reduce most of the dangerous goods paperwork and this is very much 5% of our traffic is well, approximately dangerous goods traffic and it served for at least 50 or 60%.
All manual work we have.
So it's it's.
It's a decent amount of reduction.
We like to to achieve.
The time here is another thing that cause it's not so easy to say how long it takes before we use the paperwork.
It depends on the legal things here going on in the Commission and and European Community.
Increase security.
We can open our reports 24 hours and we can do it without checking stuff.
We can't do it without security stuff, but we can do it without manual service.
Instead of standing out by customer 12:00 o'clock, you can start at seven 7:00 o'clock in the morning is that.
At the time, the check-in checkout process is time defined.
That is completely different today can take 10 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, one hour depending on the workload for this off.
If you have done the pre checkin you can always go in in a time defined process.

An active interface to fold it for the visibility of the Cold War.
Of course we can push out messages to both the forwarders and hauliers about what's happening with the with the traffic.
And the whole yes can also via the interface.
We are the check-in interface, yet status of when to collect things they can pull for information.
And of course with web services and messaging systems, you save time.
It's real time communication, you get information earlier and you can act faster.
You can reduce problems before they occur.
And you can communicate things before the trip started.

Working with the API's.
The platform and framework we have recently talked about.
Platform services and.

Sorry our operational assistance.
And map them towards our end systems interfacing to each other.

So this is mainly.
What we are doing.
This is the model.
This is what's interesting.
Here is not business.

Nothing else.
